alert.note: Alert for Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Northern El Paso County, Monument Ridge, Rampart Range Below 7500 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 13 at 11:01AM MDT until June 16 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of east central Colorado, including the following areas, Colorado Springs Vicinity/Southern El Paso County/Rampart Range Below 7400 Feet and Northern El Paso County/Monument Ridge/Rampart Range Below 7500 Feet. * WHEN...Until 9 PM MDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks and rivers are possible. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Much of El Paso County saw very heavy rainfall yesterday, and any additional rainfall today could lead to further flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay tuned to additional forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Northern El Paso County, Monument Ridge, Rampart Range Below 7500 Ft
